declaration.statement: We will have full self-driving this year.
declaration.statement_context: Elon Musk statement during Tesla Q4 2022 earnings call, January 25, 2023. Similar claims made annually since 2016.
declaration.source_excerpt: I'm highly confident the car will be able to drive itself with reliability in excess of a human this year.

expected_outcome.description: Tesla achieves SAE Level 4 or Level 5 autonomy - no human supervision required in defined conditions

success_conditions: FSD available requiring no driver attention
OR regulatory approval for unsupervised operation
failure_conditions: No regulatory approval for hands-free operation

operationalization.operationalization_notes: Interpreting 'full self-driving' per SAE J3016 definitions. True FSD requires no human supervision under operating conditions.

evidence.source_title: Tesla Autopilot & Full Self-Driving Support Page
evidence.summary: Tesla FSD Beta (v12) documentation states system 'requires active driver supervision' and is classified as SAE Level 2. No regulatory approval for unsupervised operation obtained in 2023.
evidence.relevance_explanation: Primary source showing FSD did not achieve 'full' self-driving as claimed - still requires human supervision.

resolution.resolution_summary: Tesla did not achieve full self-driving by end of 2023. FSD remains SAE Level 2, requiring constant driver supervision.
resolution.resolution_details: Despite significant improvements to FSD Beta throughout 2023, the system continues to require active driver supervision per Tesla's own documentation. This is the 7th consecutive year this annual claim has not been met.
